intro: We have already said YES to love, and the greatest blessing of that love is our little Mayla. Today, we invite you to celebrate this love with us, surrounded by all those we love.
date_quandrep: From Saturday, August 8 to Sunday, August 9, 2026
date_ourep: At the Berghotel Ch√§serstatt, 3995 Ernen, Valais
histoire_annik: "We literally shared EVERYTHING together: the first glances, the first vacations, the first disagreements... and even the first breakup" ‚Äì Annik
histoire_joaquim: "If our love lasts one year apart, it will last for a lifetime" ‚Äì Joaquim
info_intro: Before packing your bags, take a few minutes to carefully read the information below. It will help you organize your trip, find out how to get there, where to stay, and what to expect once you arrive. Nothing complicated, we promise‚Äîjust a few practical details to know so that everything goes smoothly!
info_trans_intro:
The wedding venue is not accessible by public transport. The nearest train station is Fiesch. From there, a car is required. If you plan to come by public transport, please let us know in advance so that we can arrange transportation for the last part of the journey.
At the end of the village of M√ºhlebach, just before the final climb, there is a large area where you can park for free. Here are the coordinates for the free parking lot in M√ºhlebach: 46¬∞24'36.0‚ÄúN 8¬∞09'30.7‚ÄùE. From there, you have two options:
info_trans_1titre: 1.	Drive up the small mountain road
info_trans_1cont: Access costs CHF 5 per car and is valid for 24 hours (so you can drive up and down as many times as you like during this period). There are plenty of parking spaces available at the top, so no need to worry about that.
info_trans_2titre: 2. Leave your car at the bottom and carpool
info_trans_2cont: The parking lot at the bottom is free and spacious. You can then share a ride with other guests for the last part of the journey (12-minute drive). Feel free to organize yourselves to make the climb easier!
info_logement_intro:
We would love for all our guests to stay on site and enjoy the weekend together. However, there are not enough beds for everyone.

Here are the different options:
info_logement_1titre: 1. Rooms at the Ch√§serstatt Hotel (on site)
info_logement_1cont: For those who wish to sleep in a room, this is possible, but at your own expense. It is also possible to add an extra mattress to each room.
info_logement_2cont:
For the adventurous, those who enjoy romantic nights under the stars, or those who are nostalgic for camping, you can pitch your tent on site free of charge. If you don't have a tent, don't worry, we can help.
You can use the hotel's toilets and showers at no extra charge.
info_logement_3cont:
If you have a van or want to sleep in your car, that's also possible!
You can use the hotel's toilets and showers at no extra charge.
info_logement_4cont: If there are no more rooms available on site and camping doesn't appeal to you, there are several hotels 15-20 minutes away by car in the villages below. We'll leave it up to you to make the reservation, but we're available if you have any questions.
info_logement_concl: You will be able to indicate your preference among the various options above in the RSVP so that we can assign you to the different rooms. If necessary, we will contact you directly about this.
info_fin_cont:
The wedding will take place over two days: Saturday and Sunday.
We, the bride and groom, will already be there a few days beforehand. If anyone would like to come earlier to enjoy the location, we would be delighted!
It will be a bit like a mini-vacation in the mountains, with a relaxed atmosphere. The accommodation and meals will be at your own expense ‚Äîbut the good times will be free.
We should mention that if you would like to spend both nights in a tent or in your car, that is also possible (at no extra cost).

If you arrive on Saturday, the festivities will begin at 2 p.m.
For those staying at the hotel on Saturday night, some rooms will be available upon arrival. If not, they will be ready by 4 p.m. at the latest. In any case, you will have a place to leave your luggage.
For those who plan to sleep in tents, we strongly recommend that you arrive a little early so that you have time to set up before the ceremony, scheduled for 2:30 p.m.
This will save you from having to leave during the party... or having to set up your tent, possibly drunk, in the dark at 4 a.m.!

As for Sunday morning, breakfast will be served between 8:00 a.m. and 10:00 a.m. Rooms must be vacated by 10:00 a.m.

sithsit_intro2:
Hello everyone,

My name is Mayla, and even though I'm only a few months old, I'm already a love expert... because I got lucky enough to be part of the most beautiful story of all, that of my parents, Annik and Joaquim.

So sit back, and I'll tell you everything from the beginning.
chap1_cont:
More than 17 years ago (yes, that's a long time for me, I'm not even 17 months old yet!), my parents met at school, in the same class. Very quickly, a rumor spread that a boy in the class was in love with my mom.

Then December 12 arrived, the famous ‚ÄúEscalade‚Äù celebration. That day, Dad sent a text message to Mom to tell her that he was going to reveal the identity of her secret admirer that very evening. During the school party, he found the courage to confess to her: ‚ÄúI'm the boy who's in love with you.‚Äù

Mom, a little surprised (and a little indecisive too), asked for time to think about it.

Spoiler alert: it took her about 30 minutes and an emergency meeting with her friends before she came back and said ‚Äúyes.‚Äù

The result: their first dance, their first kiss... and the beginning of their story.
chap2_cont:
What happened next? Activities, outings, long goodbyes behind the woodpile, movies, restaurants... in short, everything you need to build lots of memories.

Then came middle school, but nothing changed in their habits. Until one day, Mom left for a year in Canada.

Want to know the funniest part? Dad missed her departure at the airport because his alarm clock didn't go off (yes, really!).

But the craziest thing about it all is that when Mom left Dad alone in Geneva to embark on this amazing adventure on the other side of the world, they were both only sixteen. They were young, good-looking, separated by the globe... and yet they never doubted. Not once! No crises, no breaks, no ‚Äúwe'll see,‚Äù nothing. Their relationship held strong‚Äîas solid as ever.

Still, we have to say thank you to Skype! Thanks to it (and also to Dad's early morning wake ups), they were able to keep talking, laughing, and loving each other despite the time difference. It just goes to show that when it's the right person, even oceans can't change anything!
chap3_cont:
Mom is leaving again... But this time she's not going very far. She's going to study sports and English in Lausanne. Dad is staying in Geneva to study biology.

As a result, they only see each other on weekends.

Then came 2020: Covid, but also their separation. It wasn't an easy time for either of them. Still, I suppose this break must have been necessary for their relationship to move forward and grow.

But fortunately, it seems that when two people are meant to be together... they always end up finding each other again.

After lockdown, Mom and Dad decided to give their relationship another chance and move in together. Well... let's just say that the first attempt wasn't a success. But since beautiful stories always find their way, they ended up getting back together for good, in a small apartment in Puplinge.
And this time, nothing separated them.
chap4_cont:
In the summer of 2024, during their trip to Norway, Dad (finally) proposed.
(Honestly, it was about time, wasn't it?)

But what they didn't know was that another happy event awaited them during that same trip... Two weeks later, they discovered that a little heart was already beating in Mom's belly: me.

Needless to say, the wedding quickly became less of a priority...

And on March 31, 2025, I made my entrance into this world and into Mom and Dad's lives.
chap5_titre: Chapter 5: And here we are today
chap5_cont:
So yes, we had to wait a while to organize this event... But it was worth it, wasn't it?

Next August, we'll be there, surrounded by all our loved ones, to celebrate 17 years of history, adventures, separations and reunions, laughter and plans.

And I'm in a good position to tell you one thing: my parents are living proof that with patience, kindness, a lot of humor, and a little Skype, love can overcome anything.
signa:
Signed: your eight-month-old narrator (and already a little proud of her parents),
Mayla
